input.label: Instruction for Enumerators 1. Introduce yourself and objectives of the survey 2. Ask the respondent whether she/he is engaged in trading sheep/goat and – if YES – ask her/his willingness to spare about one hour with you.

Introduction: We are from International Center for Agricultural Research in Dry Areas and International Livestock Research Institute. These two institutions are going to work on the development of sheep/goat value chain in your area with the purpose of improving the wellbeing of female and male smallholder households and other value chain actors including traders, input suppliers, processors, transporters and consumers through improved income and nutrition. We would like to know the current status of sheep and goat production, input supply, marketing, processing and consumption in order to be able to measure changes over time after our interventions. For this purpose, we are interviewing randomly selected households and firms who keep sheep/ goats or process or market them. Your business firm is one of these randomly selected firms and we would like to talk to you. The interview will take about 1 hour. All the information we obtain will remain strictly confidential and your answers will never be shared with anyone other than our team.
May I start now?

select1.label: A. Did the household consent to the interview?
A. If no, why?

item.label: Respondent does not have the time
Household head (or other knowledgeable member) is not present at the house

input.label: Section C: Transaction costs
input.hint: Use the forward arrow button to continue

input.label: Kindly ask the information below for SHEEP ONLY

C2. How many GOATS do you buy per month?

C3. For how many months do you do this business in a year (considering the fasting months) for GOATS?

C12. What is your approximate turnover per year GOATS? (this means the sum total of all sales of all products) (Birr)
C13.What is the share of SHEEP sales from the total sales? (%)
C13.What is the share of GOATS sales from the total sales? (%)
